text:
Hong Kong: Top 10 Spots to View Chinese National Day Fireworks 
Foodie Friday Hundreds of thousands of fireworks enthusiasts will line both sides of Victoria Harbour to watch the Chinese New Year fireworks display on 1 October 2015. Rather than fighting the crowds, why not book a table? Fireworks display over Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong as viewed from the Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong. Photo Credit: Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong. Chinese National Day will be celebrated throughout Greater China on 1 October 2015 with one exception. Taiwan will celebrate its National Day on 10 October, which commemorates the Xinhai Revolution, which overthrew the Qing Dynasty 10 October 1911. In Hong Kong, hundreds of thousands of people will line both sides of Victoria Harbour on Thursday 1 October 2015 to witness the Chinese National Day fireworks extravaganza, which gets underway at 9 pm. While most people will gather along the waterfront to watch the spectacular fireworks display, a more comfortable way to witness it is from the dining rooms or outdoor terraces of restaurants or bars with views of Victoria Harbour. Restaurants all over town will be offering special set menus and buffet dinners to celebrate the occasion. A short list of hotels and restaurants with the best views of the fireworks follows. Make sure to book tables well in advance as popular venues are expected to sell out. Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong - several food and beverage outlets have harbour views. Hong Kong. InterContinental Hong Kong - several food and beverage outlets have harbour views. Kowloon. Wooloomooloo Prime - on the 21st floor of The One. Kowloon.
